snippet: The study, in the Journal of Trauma and Acute Care Surgery, describes a New York where listening to music, wearing a bicycle helmet or hailing a cab can change a life.
abstract: Study published in Journal of Trauma and Acute Care Surgery presents data regarding pedestrians and cyclists injured in collisions in New York City from December 2008 to June 2011; notes that pedestrians struck by cars are most often hit in crosswalks, and taxicabs pose disproportionate threat to cyclists; study could help inform transportation planning in city.
lead_paragraph: The study, in the Journal of Trauma and Acute Care Surgery, describes a New York where listening to music, wearing a bicycle helmet or hailing a cab can change a life.

headline.seo: Study Details Injuries to Pedestrians and Cyclists in New York City
headline.main: Crosswalks in New York Are Not Havens, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: City Crosswalk Is Not a Haven, A Study Shows
